Reviews.Title: “Walk to EVERYTHING, perfect and great value!”
Reviews.Author: Sara S
Reviews.Content: Friendly couple. We didn't speak the same language but always managed to accomplish what we wanted. Very helpful with maps of the city and ride back to the airport. Clean and very pleasant, small, but perfect room and bathroom. I could walk to all the museums and plazas as well as several cathedrals. I'd stay here again in a minute. Loved Madrid, partly because this place was so convenient and comfortable. I felt a little like I had my own tiny apartment in the city!

Reviews.Title: “Happy happy happy!”
Reviews.Author: Feistygal
Reviews.Content: This is a great place to stay for a low price. Everything I've wanted to see is within walking distance. Good wifi too! You could not do better on a budget.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous location, terrific management and clean!”
Reviews.Author: Abby L
Reviews.Content: I stayed in a single room at Pension Jaen for three days at the beginning of April 2012. The location could NOT have been better - walking distance from the "big three" museums, Plaza Mayor and other big time cultural centers. I did not have to take a cab or metro once from the hostel. The management does not speak English, but they are so patient and accommodating that I got along fine with my extremely broken Spanish! The room was small but what I expected for a single room, and the bathroom facilities were also small, but worked just fine. They clean up after you each day and make the bed, clean the bathroom, etc. I never had a problem with street noise except during futbol games, but that's half the fun :) I definitely recommend this place if you're on a budget and just looking for a nice, clean facility to stay in Madrid.

Reviews.Title: “Small rooms but clean with great location and excellent price!”
Reviews.Author: AceBuffe
Reviews.Content: Jaen is in a great location. Never took a bus in 4 days. About 5 block walk from airport express bus stop Ceribes(sp). Balcony room (#4) open to interior view was small but comfortable. Shower had good size and lots of hot water! Place was quiet except one night when a party was held in adjacent building. Exit right then right at De Leon and 1st cafe is perfect for breakfast! Would return in a heartbeat! PS great Wi-Fi!!!

Reviews.Title: “it has everything you need”
Reviews.Author: patkosvero
Reviews.Content: It's a cheap hostel with little, well-equipped rooms. The arrangement is modern, but not so special. Our room had a shower too, it was comfortable and clean. I think the city center is very noisy, so central location in Madrid often means really noisy location, but in this case fortunately our room was enough silent, we slept very well. The personnel was helpful and friendly. I'd definitely return again, I can advice it to everyone!

Reviews.Title: “hidden gem!!”
Reviews.Author: anonxxx
Reviews.Content: veeeeeeeeeerrrrrrrrrry friendly and helpful personel; very good location; good price, wunderful room; so go there!

Reviews.Title: “Great deal! Wonderful location, great staff, quiet & clean!”
Reviews.Author: cmwaddell
Reviews.Content: Me & my boyfriend loved our stay at Hostal Jaen. It is located very close to Las Huertas which has great places to go out, Plaza de Santa Ana which has incredible dinner spots, near the metro at Anton Martin, and also very close to Puerta del Sol (the center of Madrid!) It is on the 3rd floor of the building but there was a nice little elevator that can take you up. I'm not sure if the owner spoke English but he realized that we weren't fluent in Spanish so he spoke slowly & simply and was very helpful and nice. The room was very cute! The decorations were wonderful & the double room came with a nice sized bathroom & shower, small balcony facing the courtyard, closet, a hairdryer, and free Wi-Fi. The other nights we spent in Madrid we stayed a little closer to Sol and it was very loud! At Hostal Jaen with our window facing the courtyard it was nice & quiet even late at night. We paid 45 euros for 1 night and it was definitely a wonderful deal! Plus check out isn't until noon which is usually nice.

Reviews.Title: “GOOD VALUE, CLEAN , GOOD LOCATION,”
Reviews.Author: charlieseven
Reviews.Content: We spent 10 days in this Hostal . the owner was very helpful and informative. The room was a little small but very clean, great shower . The location is great , walking distance to almost everything in the historical part of Madrid. Lots of places to eat in the area. We would use it again. For the price I don't think you can't beat it.

Reviews.Title: “Homey spot in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: syasin_nyc
Reviews.Content: Pension Jaen is located in an apartment building -- we were a little surprised to find out -- but it lends to its very homey feeling. The owners even cooked dinner and ate in the dining room in the apartment unit too! It was quite close to the Anton Martin stop on the subway light blue line (#8?) but we were able to just walk everywhere we wanted to visit (closest sights is Casa de Lope de Vega just down the street, and is in between Prado Museum, Thyssen-Bornemisza Museum, and Puerta de Sol) We had a room just behind the front desk and it overlooked a hotel's or restaurant's outdoor space with canopy, so it was quite pretty. I was happy to see the floor-to-ceiling window. The furniture was basic, with a bed, night table with drawers, armoire, desk, TV, chairs and hooks on the wall for jackets (I liked!). There was a tub in the bathroom and I thought it was funny that the bathroom is connected to the room not only by the door but also a "peek window" that reminds me of Japanese love hotels. The owners were so friendly although the husband who checked us in and out spoke almost no English. His daughter spoke English though. At EUR40 a night it was such a great find.

Reviews.Title: “Very priceworthy homey atmosphere in the center of Madrid”
Reviews.Author: missanGothenburg
Reviews.Content: No frills, resonably priced, friendly owners and staff, clean, homey and quiet for being in the middle of Madrid!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: big_hungry_baboon
Reviews.Content: Lovely pension in a great location. Very clean, safe, friendly owners, lovely old building. We are going back.

Reviews.Title: “A great stay in Madrid”
Reviews.Author: UrbanDane
Reviews.Content: This is a wonderful little pensione in a quiet street, It is owned by an elderly couple that don't speak English but one gets by ;o) It's situated in the middle of the old Las Letras neighbourhood near Plaza Santa Ana which has been converted into a pedestrian area. It's a five minute walk to the Prado and there are tons of restaurants in the area. Just a wonderful place and I will stay here next time I'm in Madrid, which by the way I totally fell in love with!

Reviews.Title: “Great Area, Good Value”
Reviews.Author: flaneuse
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located in a great area: right near the Prado, but in a warren of streets with a nice neighbourhood-y feel. Although there is no breakfast included, there is a great cafe around the corner (and lots of restaurants in the area). The hotel is also near a beautifully-restored old cinema (the Cine Dore) that shows classic VO movies for less than two euros. Although the rooms aren't stand-outs decoration-wise, they are quite modern, have wall safes and TVs, and are very clean. The owners were really great. Not only did they collect mail addressed to me weeks before I arrived, but they upgraded my room for free. I'd originally booked a single with no bathroom, but they gave me a double with an ensuite bath simply because it was available (and this was for an entire week in high season!). I'm definitely going back.

HotelInfo.Name: Pension Jaen
HotelInfo.Address: Cervantes 5, 28014 Madrid, Spain
